title: Social Competency and Citizenship Development Program through Middle School Computer Science and Digital Literacy Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computational thinking at the primary and secondary education level, foundational understanding of social institutions, and basic awareness of civic rights and responsibilities.
context.additional_context: Customized activity design considering gender characteristics and learning tendencies, with project-based assessments measuring learning outcomes. Emphasizes awareness of rights/responsibilities in digital environments, social relationship-building competencies, and integration of civic education elements for community problem-solving

learning_goals: Explain fundamental algorithm concepts through unplugged activities and cultivate social relationship and civic engagement skills for solving real-life problems.

Learners design a collaborative project in teams of 3â€“4, using play robots to solve real-life problems (e.g., recycling sorting), create presentation materials applying three principles of digital citizenship (privacy protection, collaborative etiquette, respect for cultural diversity, etc.), and achieve an average score of 4 or higher on a peer evaluation (5-point scale).

Through a computer science interest assessment by field (theory/applied), learners diagnose their individual career direction and explore connections between future job markets and potential societal contributions.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
